intro: Pedilonum quinquecostatum, commonly known as the five-costed pedilonum, is a rare and unique plant species characterized by its distinctive five-costate structure in its fruiting bodies. It belongs to the family Pedilonaceae and is native to specific regions in South America, particularly in the Andean foothills. The plant exhibits a herbaceous growth habit with simple, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically displaying a pale green to white coloration. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Pedilonum quinquecostatum is considered a species of conservation concern.
